meanings.definition: To stretch out one's body or neck in order to see something better.
meanings.sent1: She craned her neck to see the parade over the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker craned his body to look at the top of the building.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat craned its neck to peek inside the box.
meanings.sent4: The flower craned towards the sunlight, reaching for its warmth.
meanings.sent5: The child craned his neck eagerly to catch a glimpse of the fireworks.

meanings.definition: To lift or move with a crane.
meanings.sent1: The workers craned the heavy container onto the truck.
meanings.sent2: The crane operator carefully craned the steel beam into place.
meanings.sent3: The movers craned the piano through the window to avoid the narrow staircase.
meanings.sent4: The helicopter craned the rescue basket down to the stranded hiker.
meanings.sent5: The construction crew craned the new air conditioning unit onto the roof.

meanings.sent1: The craned stood gracefully by the water, its long neck reflecting in the pond.
meanings.sent2: The ancient craned was a symbol of wisdom and longevity in the culture.
meanings.sent3: The majestic craned was featured in the painting hanging in the museum.
meanings.sent4: The rare craned was spotted by birdwatchers in the nature reserve.
meanings.sent5: The colorful craned danced elegantly in the field, captivating all who watched.
